intro: Palicourea muscosa, commonly known as the hairy palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving the plant its common name, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Palicourea muscosa is also noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
